name: VACATION IN A BOTTLE Mini Perfume Set
categories: Fragrance, Value & Gift Sets, Perfume Gift Sets
about: Set Description:Use your imagination to create your own scent mood with this super-giftable and travel-friendly set featuring the coveted and colorful, 10 mL deluxe miniature bottles! Wear them alone or layer together to discover your own signature scent combination..About the Bottles:KAYALI‚Äôs signature, diamond-shaped bottles and opulent jeweled caps are inspired by traditional Middle Eastern oud bottles. The number indicates the rounds of formulations it took to achieve the perfect scent..About the Fragrance:Your passport to paradise. Travel through the power of fragrance with this limited-edition Vacay in a Bottle set. Playful yet luxurious, let your senses roam free and your wanderlust go wild as you discover four fragrant destinations as imagined by KAYALI..This Set Contains:- 4 x 0.33 oz/ 10 mL fragrances in Marrakesh in a Bottle Orange Blossom | 24, Capri in a Bottle Lemon Sugar | 14, Maui in a Bottle Sweet Banana | 37, Maldives in a Bottle Ylang Coco | 20
ingredients: Marrakesh in a Bottle Orange Blossom | 24  .Sd Alcohol 40-B/Alcohol Denat, Fragrance/Parfum, Water/Aqua/Eau, Linalool, Benzotriazolyl Dodecyl P-Cresol, Butylphthalimide, Ethylhexyl Salicylate, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Isopropylphthalimide, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Tocopherol, Methyl Benzoate, Bht, Benzyl Alcohol, Benzoic Acid, Benzyl Salicylate, Limonene, Geraniol, Farnesol, Hydroxycitronellal, Citral, Hexyl Cinnamal, Citronellol, Benzyl Benzoate, Anise Alcohol, Isoeugenol, Benzyl Alcohol Voc: 70%...Capri in a Bottle Lemon Sugar | 14  .Sd Alcohol 40-B/Alcohol Denat, Fragrance/Parfum, Water/Aqua/Eau, Benzotriazolyl Dodecyl P-Cresol, Butylphthalimide, Ethylhexyl Salicylate, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Isopropylphthalimide, Tocopherol, Bht, Limonene, Linalool, Geraniol, Citral, Benzyl Salicylate, Benzyl Benzoate Voc: 70%...Maui in a Bottle Sweet Banana | 37 .Sd Alcohol 40-B/Alcohol Denat, Fragrance/Parfum, Water/Aqua/Eau, Benzyl Salicylate, Benzotriazolyl Dodecyl P-Cresol, Butylphthalimide, Ethylhexyl Salicylate, Butyl Methoxydibenzoylmethane, Isopropylphthalimide, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Tocopherol, Methyl Benzoate, Benzyl Alcohol, Ethyl Benzoate, Bht, Coumarin, Linalool, Benzyl Benzoate, Farnesol, Benzyl Alcohol Voc: 70%...Maldives in a Bottle Ylang Coco | 20   .Sd Alcohol 40-B/Alcohol Denat, Fragrance/Parfum, Water/Aqua/Eau, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Tocopherol, Methyl Benzoate, Ethyl Benzoate, Propionic Acid, Linalool, Limonene, Hydroxycitronellal, Citronellol, Coumarin, Farnesol, Geraniol, Citral, Cinnamal Voc: 70%.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Spritz perfume on your pulse points: inside of the wrists, behind the knees, the center of the chest, nape of the neck, behind the ears, and clothes for a more powerful scent trail. .-For even longer wear, be sure to moisturize with balm or lotion before spritzing on the body. .-For a delicate diffusion, spray on your hair towel before drying your hair or directly onto your hairbrush before styling.

reviews.review_title: Kayali Vacation in a Bottle Set
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Bought this during the sale since it was a better value than buying individual travel sprays.  Knowing that I like the Kayali fragrances that I have, I was expecting to like these.  I was wrong.  First of all, this was a blind buy.  I have no Sephora within 50 miles other than my Kohls Sephora, which carries Kayali but has none of the Vacation scents.  There is nothing unique about any of these fragrances.  The orange bottle starts out interesting and somewhat oriental but fades and at end of day smelled like Paradox slightly.  The yellow bottle smelled on me straight up like Warm Vanilla Sugar from Bath and Body Works.  The green bottle smelled like any of the beach scents like Beach Walk or the beach scent that Tom Ford has.  The blue bottle was also beachy but had more coconut like Victoria's Secret Bombshell Isle.  All faded into basically nothing but a white musk sort of vanilla scent.  Very disappointed.  If you can test these in a store, then do so before buying.  Also to test the longevity on you.  Reduced stars due to lack of uniqueness and no staying power.  Hope this helps.  Everyone is unique in how perfumes smell on them, but if a new perfume is a dup for something already out there, I like to know exactly which ones.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As a major Kayali fan i was super excited for these. Starting off with the Marrakesh - I felt it was a little too floral for me and a tad spicy. Didn't get much of the orange at all, so not a fan of this one - 3/10. However, the Capri smells like candied lemons, like the way a lemon/pineapple gummy bear tastes - 8/10. The Maui smells like a really good sunscreen, and the banana notes come out more when it dries down but i quite enjoyed it - 8/10. Now the Maldives is a straight 10/10. the mix of Ylang Ylang and Coconut is perfect. They truly smell like little vacations in a bottle.

reviews.review_text: Wore these on vacation in Jamaica and I‚Äôm telling you , I was loving every scent . They all worked so well in the hot weather and lasted all day . My family members asked me to leave them In ja so I re ordered soon as I came home . Love !!!

reviews.review_text: I read the reviews and listened to TikTok before buying. Reviews were 50/50. My bestie bought the set and I smelled all four. We loved each one. I can‚Äôt wait until they are available in a larger size. These are truly vacations in a bottle.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Honestly, I'm glad I got caught up in the hype and purchased these. These are all great summer perfumes, and easily my favorite perfumes from Kayali so far. I mostly wanted this set for Capri (it's like Hard to Get, but less harsh and more 'natural' smelling) but I ended up loving Maui as well (smells lightly of cool banana and banana trees, a little powdery at the end). Maldives (very fresh, aquatic and I can't smell the rosemary individually) and Marrakesh were surprisingly nice as well. I personally don't think Marrakesh smells like Killian LDBS at all - it's much more fresh and light and a bit more spicy while still being cool.  I appreciate that these all have a 'coolness' to them instead of having warmth that could clash with a hot summer day. And these all smell quite natural. I feel like it's easy for a synthetic smell to become too much in the heat. I really hope that Kayali comes out with these individually (at least for Maui and Capri!) as I really do think these are her best fragrances yet.  That being said, if you are someone who likes/enjoys beastmode type perfumes, these are probably not for you. They are all on the lighter side and last for 4-6 hours and have minimal projection. All of these are office safe.

reviews.review_text: I love me some Kayali. But this set didn‚Äôt give what I was anticipating. There‚Äôs 1 and a possible that I would consider buying in the travel size; sweet banana and lemon sugar. I liked orange blossom the least and  Maldives in a bottle was just okay.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was really hoping to love all 4 of these but 3 out of 4 is not bad.  Best is Maui - Sweet Banana (can't say I really smell banana but it is a tropical summer scent - could have left out the sandlewood part, in my opinion), then Capri - Lemon sugar I also like as it is not too kitchen lemon scented, Marrakesh - Orange blossom is a take or leave it scent and the last one Maldives when I first tried it somehow I smelled camfor oil, like vick's that my mom would put on my chest when I was sick.  I just asked a guy colleague now and he didn't think it smelt like that.  So now that I just smell the bottle I can the rosemary which I typically like, but it somehow is not sitting right with me.  Perhaps I don't know what Ylang-ylang truly is.  The bottles are very cute, easy to toss in your summer purse.  I think it is worth a try but probably just wait for your favs to come available instead of getting this whole set as the full price point for all 4 is just a little bit less than if you bought this same sizes sold separately (based on other fragrances available in the same size)

Maldives was pretty and I liked the top of Merrekesh but the dry down reminds me of incense which I can‚Äôt stand. reviews.review_text: I enjoy Maui and Maldives so much. They are different from a line that brings so much of the same scent profile. I keep a large collection and am always trying new scents. With the exception of cheapies and older fragrances, Marrakesh and Capri are some of the worst I have ever smelled. Though Marrakesh has a bit more promise. How can I justify keeping the set when only half are fantastic and the other half are a bit sickening?

I feel like the orange one isn't getting much love in reviews,  but the dry down is absolutely beautiful...maybe a little more floral sexy than sweet/fresh like the others.  Love them all!

reviews.review_text: Love LOVE capri and Maui !! Hope she decides to sell  them separately ! Marrakesh is my least favorite

reviews.review_title: Not a Must Have, It‚Äôs Ok
reviews.review_text: FIRST: do not leave a review if you haven‚Äôt actually tried it because that is not helpful to people trying to decide even if you leave a positive review.  The set is OK. I‚Äôve purchased it twice. My sister actually loved mine so she took it and I had to reorder lol.  In order of least favorite to most favorite:   Lemon Sugar: 2/5 (smells really artificial)   Orange blossom: 2.5/5 (artificial but slightly better than the lemon one)  Maui: I liked it a lot more than the others  the smell was really relaxing. 3.0/5  Maldives: for some reason I liked this one most 4/5  When you average my ratings it‚Äôs about 2.8 out of 5 which is slightly below ok. I‚Äôll round it up to 3 which is a passing score for me BUT just barely.   If you factor in pricing which isn‚Äôt awful: you get 4 minis for 100 dollars plus tax so they average out to around 25 dollars a bottle.   The packaging is cute but what REALLY matters in the longevity and your body chemistry. Cute packaging doesn‚Äôt matter when the goal is to smell good as long as possible. They don‚Äôt smell awful, I just wouldn‚Äôt buy a full bottle of any of them if they were sold separately EXCEPT for Maldives and MAYBE Maui. They project for about 1.5-2.5 hours on me. Which is also ok for a perfume that‚Äôs about 25 dollars.   You can pass on this one because it‚Äôs not a must have, but if you‚Äôre a fruit and Kayali lover you can add this to your collection since it‚Äôs limited edition.   For reference I prefer the other scents like Eden Juicy Apple and Vanilla Candy Sugar from this house. Vanilla 28 is also pretty cool. But I strongly dislike the Eden Sparkling Lychee one. All the scents here smell better than the Sparkling Lychee in my opinion. Take that information with what you will lol.

reviews.review_title: Desperate for a full bottle of Capri!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not all of these are a 10/10 but I'm happy to have been able to try them all.  Capri  The best one of this set. Beautiful summer scent. To me it smells like strawberry lemonade sugar cookies. My husband loves this one and said it's his favorite perfume I've ever worn and actually asked me to get a full bottle of it. I am literally begging for a full release of at least this one!  Marrakesh First sniff immediately reminded me of LDBS thanks to the orange blossom. I would buy a bottle of this as a super loose dupe for that.   Maui  I like it well enough, definitely a nice tropical coconut with a hint of banana laffy taffy. Not much projection on me for this one sadly  Maldives Reminded me of a bath and body works scent I have that I can't remember but enjoyed once. Sort of simple, but beautiful. Gives me the most beach vibe out of all of them and I would probably buy a full bottle.

reviews.review_title: Only 1 out of the 4 are truly unique

reviews.review_text: mediocre set. None of the scents stood out to me as anything more than elevated body sprays except the maldives one. I would buy a full bottle of that - but for $100, I'm not keeping that small bottle and will return the set. Disappointing because there are a few Kayali scents that I adore, but this set is overhyped.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Tan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: In general, all the bottles smell good, I don't give it 5 stars since Marrakesh for me is too strong, a smell that is not pleasant at all along the lines of the others.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I think the fragrances are nice, though generic. Two bottles arrived leaking with some type of weird residue inside the caps (like a crusty substance). Having to send back for a replacement, just not what I expect when I order new items. This is the second time I've had issues with the Kayali minis, not to mention my yellow bottle (capri) was just barely over half full. I have to imagine it was also leaking, but who knows. All I know is the Kayali minis leak like crazy, and Kayali doesn't bother to have a standard fill level, so you may be left wondering whether they were under-filled, or if there is just no QC. A brand of this caliber should do better.  Fragrances themselves are alright, nothing super unique or mind-blowing though. I'd probably give 4 stars (they are cute) if it weren't for the quality issues.

reviews.review_title: Capri/Maui are nice but borderline BBW scents
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Marrakesh is very strong on the Orange blossom/musk. Capri is very citrus, sweet and creamy. Maui is very tropical and sweet. Love the hint of banana. But not unique IMO. Maldives rosemary scent is bright, different.

reviews.review_text: I love Kayali, and I love smaller bottle sizes, so this felt like a win for me. It smells like sunscreen to my nose, so this does knock a star off my review. The lemon sugar scent is sweet, gourmand, and yummy. It‚Äôs exactly as I imaged it to be. Here‚Äôs where I had a happy accident: I was not sure how the sweet banana or the ylang coconut would smell. Both are great! I‚Äôm not a coconut person whatsoever, but the coconut notes in both are subtle and lean much more sweet, like co o milk. Sweet banana smells much sweeter in the bottle than on the skin; on skin it leaned more fresh and soft. Ylang coco was the standout for me. It‚Äôs sweet, clean, and bright. If the orange blossom was more orange zest and way less grandmas flowers it would be a 10/10 set for me.

reviews.review_text: Marrakesh: This is by far my least favorite offering of the Vacation in a Bottle set and of the entire Kayali collection. When there is orange blossom in a scent, it is the only thing I can smell. This is no exception. I literally smell NOTHING but orange blossom. I wish there was some hint of the iconic Kayali DNA in this...something to make it a little more unique. It could also be that this perfume is just not meant for me. I will likely not ever wear this, but it certainly is pretty on my perfume shelf.  Capri: This is nice, but smells exactly like Xerjoff's Lira or FRVR Mood's Hard to Get. Vanilla lemon sums it up.  Maui: The beauitful banana in this at the top is so incredible and addicting! Unfortunately the banana doesn't stick around very long and the dry down leads to something a little more generic, but still very nice. My second favorite of the bunch.  Maldives: THIS! I didn't have the highest expectations for this one since Coconut and Ylang Ylang are quite common notes, especially during the warmer months. But this is so beautiful. It reminds me of BDK's Pas Ce Soir, which is one of my favorite scents ever. Smells like a luxurious, rich hotel lobby.

reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm really loving this collection just as I had expected I would! I‚Äôm even enjoying all 4 of them, they‚Äôre very transportation! They‚Äôre bright, fun, fresh, and unique scents packaged in beautiful bottles! They are lighter than a lot of other Kayali scents without the exotic Middle Eastern twist a lot of their fragrances have. The only one that really has a touch of that vibe is Marrakech, but I think that‚Äôs to be expected. It‚Äôs a lovely & unique orange blossom and bergamot prominent scent. Maldives is beautiful, fresh, aquatic, tropical, and sweet! The coconut milk and ylang ylang are prominent. It has a fresh, bright, and unique twist of refreshing lemon and rosemary. Maui is such a pretty fruity, tropical, sweet, and creamy scent with prominent coconut cream and banana notes! The pear note adds a nice freshness! Capri is a happy, bright, fun, and sweet scent with a scent of candied lemon and sweet raspberry with a slightly musky vanilla dry down keeping it from being too sweet. All 4 scents are pretty & perfect for summer! They each have a slightly unique feel, that‚Äôs still very beautiful & easily wearable! I get good performance with all 4! They last throughout the day & project at least an arm‚Äôs length! I‚Äôm really glad that I ended up getting 2 of these incredible sets!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have to be honest, I was underwhelmed with these scents. I was sooo excited for them, and they flopped for me. I‚Äôve seen others say they do not like Marrakesh, and I have to agree. It‚Äôs not terrible, but very mature type feel to it. The orange blossom is trying to come through, but I think the pink pepper and rose are dominant. I want to give it a chance but I can‚Äôt see myself ever wanting to smell like this. 5/10. Capri is lemony and sweet, probably my favorite one. But still not anything spectacular about it. I have D&G Devotion and it feels like a lesser version of that. 8/10. Maui is the one I was most excited about, and it smells nothing like I would have thought. I would expect it to smell mainly like banana being that it is called ‚ÄòSweet Banana.‚Äô 7/10. Maldives smelt good on the initial spray, but there is something unpleasant about it when it dries on my skin. It‚Äôs subtle, and I‚Äôm not sure what it is but it‚Äôs turning me off of it. 6/10. Overall, I‚Äôm disappointed by this set. The packaging and all that is gorgeous, but the bottles aren‚Äôt even full all the way, and for the price and size I expect better. Debating if I should just take the L or return.

reviews.review_title: Something for everyone, good value for travel size
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Value: poor value on a per ml basis, normally a 50 ml Kayali perfume is $100, while this set is 40ml of juice total for the same price. However, it‚Äôs good value if you are looking for travel sizes since normally a Kayali travel size is $32. Scents: Marrakesh is a woody floral, you get mostly cedarwood on the dry down with some orange blossom. The opening is similar to Love Don‚Äôt Be Shy, but the dry down is NOT sweet or sugary at all, which is refreshing coming from Kayali. Maldives is a little fruity in the opening and dries down to a true aquatic. Maui is a classic sweet and creamy tropical scent, similar but not identical to Bora Bora. Capri is my least favorite, it is extremely sweet and very similar to D&G Devotion if you like that. I appreciate how each fragrance in this set belongs to a different family so you have variety. That said, because they are all quite different you might not like all of them. I will certainly be enjoying 3 out of the 4 and will use them for travel.

reviews.review_text: Okay guys I'm going to be recording my first impressions for my Sephora review to help people get a sense of the fragrances. First up is Maui in the bottle. I know a lot of people are excited for this one. (Sprays and smells fragrance) It's a hit. So sweet. 10 out of 10. Oh my goodness. So delectable. Just like candy. Okay next is Marrakesh and this is the one I'm most excited for. (Sprays and smells fragrance) I'm already getting that Neroli. It smells like a spa. It's got a sweet white floral note in it, but you can also smell the cedar wood in there. But it's not off-putting, which I was garnering from a lot of other reviews I've seen of this scent. It is Sexy and mysterious. Mmm, yeah, that's good.All right, Capri in a bottle. Lemon sugar, 14. Let's try it.(Sprays and smells) Mmm. That smells so really good. I'm getting something very nostalgic.Oh, it smells like a pretty drink.Okay, that's a really, really pretty lemon. I was a little bit skeptical of this one as well because I'm not a fan of lemon scents or I guess more specifically bright lemon scents. A bright lemon usually reminds me of kitchen cleaner. But this one is definitely lemon sugar. Sugar being the key word here. It's like a lemon pound cake or a lemon drink. I don't even know, it's so good.All right, Maldives in a bottle. Ylang Coco.(Sprays and smells) Oh my goodness. That is freaking delicious. That's a fruity dream. I am getting star fruit and I freaking love it. I am getting this Bath and Body works scent I wore when I was younger. It was called Amazon Rain and it had a star fruit note and I love that. That fragrance always got me a lot of compliments. This is that, but more  luxurious. Wow. Wow, wow, these are all gorgeous and unique in their own right.  Not one of them is a miss for me. This is a great set for the summertime. I would gladly rush to buy all of these scents in bigger bottles if they ever released them ‚õ±Ô∏èü©µüß°üíöüíõ

reviews.review_title: I love that its NOT like any other Kayali perfume
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was low key excited but reserved. bc the typical hype train yet NO one had even tried this set yet.  To my surprise, actually really like this set! I have a few Kayali fragrances already but some are just too intense for me.  Kayali tends to have Patchouli Sandalwood DNA dry down. (That can be too heavy for summer imho.) What I like is that these AREN'T the typical Kayali DNA. Be your own mixologist and add these to your existing Van 28 or Coconut Utopia etc. It adds some sweetness, lightness, airiness, freshness that I personally like to the mix.   1) My fav is Maldives!! It's aquatic, little floral & most complex. Reminds of my Armani Acqua di Gioia which is my fav summer fragrance. It reminds me of relaxing at an exclusive bungalow with a breeze of tropical florals floating across the water.. just after an afteroon rain shower. SO GOOD! (Please make these full size Mona!)  2)I like Capri it's light, airy sugary lemon but not too sugary or in your face lemon zest. It's yummy, warm, cozy .. easy skin scent. I smell the raspberry in dry down on me.   3)I also like Maui, it has a slight hint of banana on my skin but fades very quickly. To a slight tropical floral & softness of coconut milk in dry down (hint of powdery softness & musk).  (Pistachio gelato was way more soapy & powdery on me for reference.)  4)The Marrakesh is pretty straight forward on the orange blossom. I don't smell anything else on skin. Not my fav scent profile w my chemistry by itself. Of course it lasts the longest lol.  Mixing this w Capri is nice & sweeter...Balances it out for me.   $100 bucks, a bit pricey but Bottles are super colorful & cute..I like having options. My mood dictates my taste for the fragrances of the day.  I think it's fun, be your own mixologist & adding a bit of fresh, vacation, beachy vibes to your already fav perfumes.   I'm really happy with my purchase! I think Mona really captured the vibe of each destination.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I will give this 3 stars instead of 5 for the reason of they smell quite similar to a few scents out :    Maui in a bottle: Vacation EDP or Sol Radiance.   Marrakesh:  Tom Ford sol blanc with slightly more added orange blossom note and more woody oud dried down.    Capri in a bottle : summery lemony vanilla sweet  like BBw Summer Melody that came out few years ago.   Maldives in a bottle:  The only different scent , that could me slightly similar to sweeter light blue type scent with an added summery aquatic sweetness sort of like light blue Forever for women without the white floral note but add freshwater summer notes.  My favorites are Maldives and Maui hands down!!     These are not weak smelling I will say , they linger.  But why not give us big bottles? Not sure im keeping these for small amounts.
